that Donald Rumsfeld described the Abu Ghraib prison abuses as the actions of rogue soldiers who went outside approved policies. Donald Rumsfeld also said he regretted not forcing President Bush to accept his resignation offers after the scandal broke. Abu Ghraib and its follow-on effects, including the continued drum-beat of` torture' maintained by partisan critics of the war and the Bill Clinton , became a damaging distraction, he wrote.`` I regret that I did not leave at that point.'' Donald Rumsfeld did not leave until after Republicans were crushed in the 2006 congressional elections. He has been mostly silent since then

Mike Pence shut the door Thursday on seeking the presidency in 2012 but left unanswered whether his choice instead is the Indiana governor's office. I'm open to running for governor, Mike Pence said in an exclusive interview with The Indianapolis Star.`` We're going to take the next several months to travel across the state and hear what Hoosiers have to say. Grizzlies in Carmelo Anthony 's return Allen Iverson raced downcourt and floated an alley-oop lob that Carmelo Anthony shoved one-handed through the hoop for an arena-rattling jam, one that seemed to holler to all their doubters,`` Take that!'' We just wanted to show the whole world we could play together, Carmelo Anthony said after the duo's triumphant debut Monday night.`` We know there's a lot of doubt about that.'' me. You're a pro. You're a hell of a lot better than others in this town.'' Howard Kurtz suspects that Donald Rumsfeld 's goal with this memoir is to leave readers with the same conclusion. But it contains few surprises and, after so many years of divisive debate, is unlikely to change many minds, writes Howard Kurtz .`` What is known is that he has in these 50 chapters marshaled his best defense; only history's final verdict remains unknown.''
